snippet: Randall Sullivan’s “Untouchable” chronicles Michael Jackson’s over-the-top fame in a book that feels as though it was constructed out of recycled materials.
abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews book Untouchable: The Strange Life and Tragic Death of Michael Jackson by Randall Sullivan.
lead_paragraph: Randall Sullivan’s “Untouchable” chronicles Michael Jackson’s over-the-top fame in a book that feels as though it was constructed out of recycled materials.

headline.seo: ‘Untouchable,’ Michael Jackson’s Life, by Randall Sullivan
headline.main: This Just In: He Was the King of Pop
headline.print_headline: This Just In: He Was the King of Pop
